title: Strengthening Practical Statistics Competencies Based on Educational Sociology for [Massive] Elementary School Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Basic statistical terminology and survey methodology comprehension, experience applying educational field data, foundational understanding of social science research methods
context.additional_context: Focused on developing practical statistical competencies for current elementary school teachers to analyze and utilize diverse data from educational settings in decision-making, with a particular emphasis on addressing social science issues like educational inequality and academic achievement gaps through statistical methods.

learning_goals: Learners will accurately calculate descriptive statistics (mean, variance, standard deviation) using educational field data and apply them to educational policy analysis.
Establish an educational effect analysis design considering sampling surveys and sampling errors, and construct a research model controlling socioeconomic variables.
Determine significant differences in educational programs through hypothesis testing and prepare educational reports and policy proposals based on statistical evidence.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
